snippet: The inquiry, to be led by Representative Darrell Issa of California and Senator David Vitter of Louisiana, will look at whether the Environmental Protection Agency allowed an advocacy group too much sway in developing a regulation to curb carbon...
abstract: Congressional Republicans are investigating whether Obama administration improperly colluded with environmental advocacy group Natural Resources Defense Council as Environmental Protection Agency drafted major climate change regulations; investigation is part of Republicans' long-running effort to block Obama's climate change agenda.
lead_paragraph: The inquiry, to be led by Representative Darrell Issa of California and Senator David Vitter of Louisiana, will look at whether the Environmental Protection Agency allowed an advocacy group too much sway in developing a regulation to curb carbon emissions.

headline.main: Republicans to Investigate Environmental Group’s Influence on Carbon Rule
headline.print_headline: Republicans to Investigate Environmental Group’s Influence on Carbon Rule
